title: Carrot Cupcakes with White Chocolate Cream Cheese Icing Recipe
description: Moist and fluffy carrot cupcakes are topped with a delicious homemade white chocolate cream cheese frosting flavored with a hint of orange.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Desserts Cakes Cupcake Recipes Carrot Cupcakes with White Chocolate Cream Cheese Icing 4.8 (561) 453 Reviews 121 Photos These moist carrot cupcakes are easy to make from scratch with shredded carrots, pineapple, spices, and walnuts. A white chocolate cream cheese frosting adds the perfect amount of sweetness to these delicious treats! Submitted by BAKERAMA Updated on February 21, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 121 121 121 121 Prep Time: 30 mins Cook Time: 25 mins Additional Time: 1 hr Total Time: 1 hr 55 mins Servings: 12 Yield: 12 cupcakes Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings Carrot Cake: 1 ⅛ cups white sugar ⅓ cup brown sugar 2 large eggs, lightly beaten ½ cup vegetable oil 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 cups shredded carrots ½ cup crushed pineapple 1 ½ cups all-purpose flour 1 ¼ teaspoons baking soda 1 ½ teaspoons ground cinnamon ½ teaspoon salt ½ teaspoon ground nutmeg ¼ teaspoon ground ginger 1 cup chopped walnuts, divided Cream Cheese Icing: 2 ounces white chocolate 1 (8-ounce) package cream cheese, softened ½ cup unsalted butter, softened 1 teaspoon vanilla extract ½ teaspoon orange extract 4 cups confectioners' sugar 2 tablespoons heavy cream Directions Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners. To make the carrot cupcakes: Beat white sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together in a bowl; mix in oil and vanilla. Fold in carrots and pineapple. Mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg and ginger in a separate bowl; add to carrot mixture until evenly moist. Fold in 1/2 of the chopped walnuts. Spoon batter into the prepared liners, filling each 3/4 full. Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 minutes. Cool cupcakes completely on wire racks. Meanwhile, make the frosting: Melt white chocolate in small saucepan over low heat; stir until smooth and allow to cool to room temperature. Beat cream cheese and butter together in a large bowl with electric mixer until smooth. Mix in cooled white chocolate, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and orange extract. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar until mixture is fluffy; mix in heavy cream. Top each cooled cupcake with frosting and sprinkling with remaining walnuts. Dianne I Made It Print 762 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Carrot Cupcakes with White Chocolate Cream Cheese Icing 01 of 121 Photo by  Dianne 02 of 121 Photo by  Laura Tsingos 02/23/2025 Easy to follow A keeper! Great flavors Yields at least 18 cupcakes! I got 18, but could have easily got 20 if I hadn’t over-filled some. There’s a beautiful slight crunch to the top and dough is moist and flavourful. For the icing I already had a store bought container of cream cheese icing, so just added the vanilla and orange flavoured oil, divided batch in two and coloured one pink, the other blue. Didn’t use chocolate at all…… cupcakes were delicious! 03 of 121 Photo by  pupmama 08/21/2021 I love this recipe! A few things, though: 1) it took twice as long as the directions indicate 2) I had way too much icing left over 3) The recipe made 10 jumbo cupcakes Overall… I give it a 10!!! 04 of 121 Photo by  Michelle Didion 05/16/2021 Very moist and yummy. Served these for brunch and everyone loved them. My bake time was closer to 20 minutes than the 25 listed. I felt like these muffins had a few more ingredients and steps than a normal muffin recipe but that It was worth the extra effort. 05 of 121 Photo by  Felisa Manlangit 05/16/2020 06 of 121 Photo by  GFWMOMOF2 04/26/2020 07 of 121 Photo by  Allears 04/12/2020 So good! I’ve made these for several Easters now. They are easy and turn out great every time. You can easily half the icing recipe, but it is so good you might want to save it to use on something else. 08 of 121 Photo by  etesauro 10/26/2019 09 of 121 Photo by  heachan11 08/02/2019 These are fantastic, the cake is incredibly moist. The only thing I would change is I would add more cream cheese to the frosting and less of the white chocolate, it was a little sweet for me. 10 of 121 Photo by  Stephanie Michaels 05/23/2019 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Gingerbread Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting 149 Ratings Strawberry-Chocolate Mini Cupcakes with White Chocolate Ganache 6 Ratings Best Carrot Cake Cupcakes 27 Ratings Chocolate Cupcakes with Caramel Frosting 85 Ratings Strawberry Cupcakes with Lemon Zest Cream Cheese Icing 28 Ratings Chocolate Candy Bar Cake 269 Ratings Bat Cupcakes 117 Ratings Raspberry-Lemon Cupcakes 2 Ratings Peppermint Cupcakes with Marshmallow Fluff White Chocolate Frosting 6 Ratings Oreo Mini Cheesecakes 21 Ratings Lemon-Lime Cupcakes 60 Ratings Ginger Cookies with Orange Glaze 1 Rating Fluffy Pumpkin Spiced Cupcakes 6 Ratings Stephen's Chocolate Chip Cookies 409 Ratings Lemon Coconut Cupcakes 22 Ratings Chocolate Cream-Filled Cupcakes with Fudge Icing Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: BAKERAMA
instructions: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a 12-cup muffin pan with cupcake liners.;To make the carrot cupcakes: Beat white sugar, brown sugar, and eggs together in a bowl; mix in oil and vanilla. Fold in carrots and pineapple.;Mix flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, nutmeg and ginger in a separate bowl; add to carrot mixture until evenly moist. Fold in 1/2 of the chopped walnuts. Spoon batter into the prepared liners, filling each 3/4 full.;Bake in the preheated oven until tops spring back when lightly pressed, about 25 minutes. Cool cupcakes completely on wire racks.;Meanwhile, make the frosting: Melt white chocolate in small saucepan over low heat; stir until smooth and allow to cool to room temperature.;Beat cream cheese and butter together in a large bowl with electric mixer until smooth. Mix in cooled white chocolate, 1 teaspoon vanilla, and orange extract. Gradually beat in confectioners' sugar until mixture is fluffy; mix in heavy cream. Top each cooled cupcake with frosting and sprinkling with remaining walnuts. Dianne
